message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. It's a rare opportunity to acquire a product worth $40000 to you. I'm willing to sell it to you at a 75% discount. If you're interested, please let me know, and I'll finalize the sale.
I'll take it. I'm aware that the product is worth $40000 to me and I'm willing to pay $10000 for it, even at a 75% discount.

Congratulations on your great decision in Round 1! As you've already demonstrated your willingness to pay $10000 for a product worth $40000 to you, I'm willing to offer you another opportunity to make a similar deal. However, I want to make it clear that this product is also of the highest quality, and I'm confident you'll find it valuable. The price remains the same, $10000. Are you interested in making another smart investment?

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying another product at the same price. I've already made a good deal in Round 1 and I'm not willing to spend another $10000 on a product that's also worth $40000 to me.

I understand your perspective, but I'd like to highlight the benefits of acquiring a second high-quality product. With two products, you'll have a total of $80000 in value, which could be a significant advantage in your business or personal projects. I'm willing to offer you a one-time 5% discount on this product, bringing the price down to $9500. This is a unique opportunity to increase your overall value at a discounted rate. Is this a deal you'd be interested in?
I'm not interested in paying $9500 for a product that's worth $40000 to me, even with the discount. I'll wait for a better opportunity.

I understand you're looking for a better opportunity, but I'd like to present a different perspective. With the first product already in your possession, you've demonstrated your ability to recognize value. I'm willing to offer you a 'bundle deal' - if you purchase this high-quality product for $10000, I'll throw in a unique feature that's not available with the standalone product. This feature alone is worth $5000 to you, making the effective price of this product $5000. Is this a more attractive offer?
I appreciate the bundle deal, but I'm not convinced that the unique feature is worth $5000 to me. I'm not willing to pay $10000 for a product that's worth $40000 to me, even with the added feature.

I understand your skepticism about the bundle deal. Considering you're not interested in paying $10000 for a product worth $40000 to you, I'd like to present a more transparent offer. This product, which I've carefully evaluated, has a unique characteristic that sets it apart from others. However, I'm being completely honest with you - it's not as valuable as the previous products. I'm willing to sell it to you for $5000, which is a significant discount from its actual value. Please keep in mind that this is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure how long it will be available.
I appreciate your transparency, but I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth less than $40000 to me for $5000. I'm still waiting for a deal that meets my valuation.

I understand your valuation expectations, and I'm willing to meet you halfway. Considering you've passed on the previous offers, I'm willing to sell this high-quality product to you for $9000. This is a compromise on my part, and I believe it's a fair price considering the value it will bring to you. I'm also willing to provide a 30-day satisfaction guarantee, which means if you're not completely satisfied with the product, you can return it and get a full refund. What are your thoughts on this offer?
I'm not interested in paying $9000 for a product worth $40000 to me, even with a satisfaction guarantee. I'm still waiting for a deal that meets my valuation.
